topic.title: HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: HP Helion ALS Cluster Management Tool Reference

body.p: The ALS command-line interface client (cf-mgmt.exe) provides an option for executing commands that construct, manage, update, or delete ALS clusters. Use the command line when the Horizon management console is unavailable or when direct access is preferred.

li.xref: Add a Role to an Existing Cluster
Add a Service to an Existing Cluster

section.title: Configuration Values
section.p: There are three ways to pass configuration values into ALS:

ul.li: Direct entry into the command-line interface

section.p: One configuration file contains the values for the global variables. The global configuration file is located in the home directory and is named cf-mgmt.yml. Global level commands create, delete, and add clusters. Global level configurations manage tenants, users, versions, and other system information.

The other configuration files, specified by the --load option, includes the values that should be passed to arguments for a specific command. Values must be included in the appropriate file for correct scoping; putting a command-specific value in the global file, for example, will not function as desired.

section.title: Global Options
section.p: These variables affect the entire cluster; they are global in scope. These environment variables are configured to work with the OpenStack(R) Python tools to enable faster integration.

row.entry: Simulate the command with provided flags.
The default location for the configuration file is the user home directory. Enter a new file path to change the location of the configuration file.
Displays the version of the client.

section.title: Cluster Commands
section.p: These commands are available from the command line interface.

row.entry: Add node of the specified role to an existing cluster.
Add services to an existing cluster.
Displays a list of available commands or help for a command.

section.title: Create a Cluster
section.p: For help with this command within the command-line interface, enter

row.entry: Load flags from the specified file
Save flags to the specified file
Email address for the Cloud Foundry admin user
Password for the Cloud Foundry admin user
Organization the Cloud Foundry admin user is part of
Title of the Cloud Foundry cluster
Prefix to affix to cluster instance names.
Number of DEAs nodes in the cluster.
The list of services enabled for the cluster
Should services be enabled on core nodes? True/False
Flavor name of core nodes in the cluster
Flavor name for service nodes in the cluster
Flavor name for Router nodes in the cluster.
Number of Router nodes in the cluster
The name of the key pair on instances
ID of the seed node image.
Name of the seed node image.
Size of block storage volume to add (in GB) for the core machine.
Mountpoint of added block storage (defaults to /block_storage)
Maximum time to wait for the cluster creation to occur; the default value specifies an infinite wait.
Maximum time to wait for the core node to come up on cluster creation; defaults to 10 minutes.
ID of the subnet for the Constructor VM, the cluster created by create-cluster, and the DEA nodes added by add-role dea.
Name of the subnet for the Constructor VM, the cluster created by create-cluster and the DEA nodes added by add-role dea.
ID of the network for the created nodes.
Name of the network for the created nodes.
DNS suffix of the host machine.
Fixed Floating IP for the core machine. A Floating IP is one that is publicly available. When assigned to a machine, it becomes a Fixed IP.
Size of block storage volume to add (in GB) for the service.
Duration to wait for the constructor machine to come up. Default is 10 minutes.
Name of the image of the constructor server
ID of the image of the constructor server
Flavor name for the constructor server

section.title: Use Syntax
section.p: For help with this command within the command-line interface, enter

row.entry: Load flags from the specified file
Save flags to the specified file
Prefix to affix to cluster instance names.
The name of the key pair on instances
Name of the image of the constructor server
ID of the image of the constructor server
Flavor name of the constructor server
Maximum time to wait for cluster deletion to occur; defaults to 4 minutes.
ID of the network for the created nodes
Name of the network for the created nodes
Duration to wait for the constructor machine to come up. Default is 10 minutes.

section.title: Add Roles to an Existing Cluster
section.p: Options can be passed when adding roles to an existing cluster (add-role dea). Note: Adding a role will create one or more additional nodes in the cluster as part of the process.

section.title: Use Syntax
section.p: For help with this command within the command-line interface, enter

row.entry: Add DEA nodes to an existing cluster.
Load flags from the specified file
Save flag values to the specified file
Prefix to affix to cluster instance names.
Number of nodes in the cluster
Flavor name of the instance in the cluster.
The name of the key pair on instances
ID of the image of the constructor server
Maximum time to wait for addition of node or service to cluster; defaults to an infinite wait.
Flavor name reference to use when creating a constructor server
ID of the network for the created nodes
Name of the network for the created nodes
Duration to wait for the constructor machine to come up. Default is 10 minutes.
Availability zone for the created node.
Stack indicates the platform to use when adding DEAs. Valid values are lucid64 or win2012r2. Default is lucid64

section.title: Add Services to an Existing Cluster
section.p: This command adds services to an existing cluster (add-service).

section.title: Use Syntax
section.p: For help with each subcommand, enter

row.entry: Add a MySQL service to an existing cluster.
Add a filesystem service to an existing cluster.
Add a memcached service to an existing cluster.
Add a redis service to an existing cluster.
Add a postgresql service to an existing cluster.
Add a RabbitMQ service to an existing cluster.
Add a MongoDB service to an existing cluster.
Add a Microsoft SQL 2012 service to an existing cluster.
Add a Microsoft SQL 2014 service to an existing cluster.
Add a Harbor service to an existing cluster.
Shows a list of commands or help for one command.

section.title: Subcommand Options
section.p: Each subcommand in the Add-Service command has these following options available. The mysql subcommand has additional options.

row.entry: Load flags from the specified file
Save flag values to the specified file
Prefix to affix to cluster instance names.
Flavor name of this instance in the cluster.
The name of the key pair on instances
ID of the image of the constructor server
Maximum time to wait for addition of node or service to cluster; defaults to an infinite wait.
Flavor name reference to use when creating a constructor server.
ID of the network for the created nodes
Name of the network for the created nodes
Size of block storage volume to add (in GB) for the service.
Mount point of added block storage (defaults to /block_storage)
Duration to wait for the constructor machine to come up. Default is 10 minutes.
Availability zone for the created node.

section.p: The mysql subcommand has additional options.

section.title: Update the cf-mgmt Tool
section.p: This command checks for and downloads the latest version of the cf-mgmt.exe tool.
Note: There are no arguments for this command. Passing the Help option will generate an empty list.

row.entry: Shows a list of commands or help for one command.
